text: He is here and she is here.
translate: Han er her og hun er her.

text: Peter and Martha are from Berlin.
translate: Peter og Martha er fra Berlin.

text: Do both of you speak German?
Madrid and Berlin are also capital cities.
translate: Madrid og Berlin er også hovedstæder.

text: Capital cities are big and noisy.
We only work for five days.
I was at the cinema yesterday.
translate: I går var jeg i biografen.
I morgen skal jeg på arbejde igen.

text: We are having class / a lesson.

translate: Det er interessant at lære sprog.

text: We want to speak with people.
Do you drink tea with lemon?
Where do they like to go?
translate: Hvor kan de lide at gå hen?

text: They like to listen to music.
translate: De kan godt lide at høre musik.

text: Where do they not like to go?
translate: Hvor kan de ikke lide at gå hen?

text: They do not like to dance.
translate: De kan ikke lide at danse.

text: Do you drink coffee with sugar?
Do you drink water with ice?
People are drinking wine and beer.
Do you drink Coke with rum?
The child likes cocoa and apple juice.
translate: Barnet kan lide kakao og æblemost.

text: The woman likes orange and grapefruit juice.
translate: Kvinden kan lide appelsinjuice og grapejuice.

text: I have a kiwi and a melon.
translate: Jeg har en kiwi og en melon.

text: I have an orange and a grapefruit.
translate: Jeg har en appelsin og en grapefrugt.

text: I have an apple and a mango.
translate: Jeg har et æble og en mango.

text: I have a banana and a pineapple.
translate: Jeg har en banan og en ananas.

text: I am making a fruit salad.

translate: Jeg spiser en skive ristet brød.

text: I am eating toast with butter.
translate: Jeg spiser en skive ristet brød med smør.

text: I am eating toast with butter and jam.
translate: Jeg spiser en skive ristet brød med smør og marmelade.

text: I am eating a sandwich with margarine.
translate: Jeg spiser en sandwich med margarine.

text: I am eating a sandwich with margarine and tomatoes.
translate: Jeg spiser en sandwich med margarine og tomat.
Vi har brug for brød og ris.
Vi har brug for fisk og bøffer.
Vi har brug for pizza og spaghetti.
Hvad har vi ellers brug for?

text: We need carrots and tomatoes for the soup.
translate: Vi har brug for gulerødder og tomater til suppen.

text: We like to go for a walk in summer.
translate: Om sommeren går vi gerne ture.

text: It snows or rains in winter.
translate: Om vinteren sner eller regner det.

text: We like to stay home in winter.
translate: Om vinteren bliver vi gerne hjemme.

text: What is the weather like today?
Do you have a new kitchen?
What do you want to cook today?
translate: Hvad for noget mad vil du lave i dag?

text: Do you cook on an electric or a gas stove?
translate: Har du et el- eller et gaskomfur?

text: Do you have a tin opener / can opener (am.)?
Do you have a bottle opener?
Are you cooking the soup in this pot?
translate: Laver du suppen i den her gryde?

text: Are you frying the fish in this pan?
translate: Steger du fisken i den her pande?

text: Are you grilling the vegetables on this grill?
translate: Griller du grøntsagerne på den her grill?

text: Here are the knives, the forks and the spoons.
translate: Her er knivene, gaflerne og skeerne.

text: Here are the glasses, the plates and the napkins.
translate: Her er glassene, tallerknerne og servietterne.

text: What colour / color (am.) is the snow? White.
What colour / color (am.) is the sun? Yellow.
What colour / color (am.) is the orange? Orange.
What colour / color (am.) is the cherry? Red.
What colour / color (am.) is the sky? Blue.
What colour / color (am.) is the grass? Green.
What colour / color (am.) is the earth? Brown.
What colour / color (am.) is the cloud? Grey / Gray (am.).
What colour / color (am.) are the tyres / tires (am.)? Black.

translate: Må jeg præsentere dig for hr. Müller?

text: Are you here for the first time?
translate: Er du her for første gang?

text: No, I was here once last year.
translate: Nej, jeg var her også sidste år.

text: How do you like it here?
A lot. The people are nice.
And I like the scenery, too.
translate: Og landskabet synes jeg også godt om.

text: No, my wife / my husband is also here.
translate: Nej, min kone / min mand er her også.

text: And those are my two children.
translate: Og der er mine to børn.
Lad som om du er hjemme!

text: What would you like to drink?
translate: Hvad vil du have at drikke?
Jeg kan godt lide klassisk musik.

text: Do you play a musical instrument?
I am currently reading this book.
translate: Jeg er ved at læse den her bog.

text: What do you like to read?
translate: Hvad kan du lide at læse?

text: Do you like to go to concerts?
translate: Kan du lide at gå til koncert?

text: Do you like to go to the theatre / theater (am.)?
translate: Kan du lide at gå i teatret?

text: Do you like to go to the opera?
translate: Kan du lide at gå i operaen?
Men nu ryger jeg ikke mere.

text: Does it disturb you if I smoke?
translate: Generer det dig, hvis jeg ryger?
Ja, for det meste på forretningsrejse.
Men nu er vi på ferie.
Ja, i dag er det virkelig varmt.
Lad os gå ud på altanen.

text: In which hotel are you staying?
How long have you been here for?
translate: Hvor længe har du været her?

text: How long will you be staying?

translate: Du er velkommen til at besøge mig.

text: Shall we see each other tomorrow?
I would like to go to the station.
I would like to go to the airport.
I would like to go to the city centre / center (am.).
How do I get to the station?
How do I get to the airport?
I am sorry, but I already have plans.
translate: Jeg har desværre allerede en aftale.

text: How do I get to the city centre / center (am.)?

translate: Jeg har brug for en taxa.
Jeg har brug for et kort over byen.
Jeg har brug for et hotel.

text: I would like to rent a car.
translate: Jeg vil gerne leje en bil.

text: What is there to see in the city?
translate: Hvad skal man se i byen?
Gå hen til den gamle bydel.

text: Go on a harbour / harbor (am.) tour.
Are there any other places of interest?
We are cleaning the apartment today.
translate: I dag gør vi rent i lejligheden.

text: My husband is washing the car.
The children are cleaning the bicycles.
The children are cleaning up the children’s room.
My husband is tidying up his desk.
translate: Min mand rydder op på sit skrivebord.

text: I am putting the laundry in the washing machine.
I am hanging up the laundry.
Yes, and I also speak some Italian.
translate: Ja, og jeg kan også lidt italiensk.

text: I think you speak very well.
translate: Jeg synes, du taler rigtig godt.

text: But speaking and writing is difficult.
translate: Men at tale og skrive er svært.
Vær sød altid at rette mig.

text: You only have a slight accent.
One can tell where you come from.
translate: Man kan høre, hvor du kommer fra.

text: What is your mother tongue / native language (am.)?
Are you taking a language course?
I don’t remember the name right now.
translate: Jeg ved i ikke lige, hvad det hedder.

text: The title is not coming to me.
Do you have a vacant room?

translate: Jeg har brug for et enkeltværelse.
Jeg har brug for et dobbeltværelse.

text: What does the room cost per night?
I would like a room with a bathroom.
translate: Jeg vil gerne have et værelse med bad.

text: I would like a room with a shower.
translate: Jeg vil gerne have et værelse med brusebad.

text: Is there a fax machine here?
What time do you serve breakfast?
What time do you serve lunch?
What time do you serve dinner?

translate: Kom du for sent til bussen?

text: I waited for you for half an hour.
translate: Jeg har ventet på dig i en halv time.

text: Don’t you have a mobile / cell phone (am.) with you?

translate: Næste gang skal du komme til tiden!
Næste gang skal du tage en taxa!

text: Take an umbrella with you next time!
translate: Næste gang skal du tage en paraply med!

text: I have the day off tomorrow.
I’m sorry, I can’t make it tomorrow.
translate: Jeg kan desværre ikke i morgen.

text: Do you already have plans for this weekend?
translate: Skal du lave noget i den her weekend?

text: Or do you already have an appointment?
translate: Eller har du allerede en aftale?

text: I suggest that we meet on the weekend.
translate: Jeg foreslår, at vi mødes i weekenden.

text: Shall we go to the beach?
Shall we go to the mountains?
translate: Skal vi tage op i bjergene?

text: I will pick you up at the office.
I will pick you up at home.
I will pick you up at the bus stop.

translate: Der er ikke noget varm vand.

text: There is no telephone in the room.
translate: Der er ingen telefon på værelset.

text: There is no TV in the room.
translate: Der er ikke noget fjernsyn på værelset.
Der er for meget larm i værelset.
Det synes jeg er for dyrt.

text: Is there a youth hostel nearby?
translate: Er der et vandrerhjem i nærheden?

text: Is there a boarding house / a bed and breakfast nearby?
translate: Er der et pensionat i nærheden?
Er der en restaurant i nærheden?

text: There is a garden behind the house.
translate: Bag huset er der en have.

text: There is no street in front of the house.
translate: Foran huset er der ikke nogen gade.

text: There are trees next to the house.
translate: Ved siden af huset er der træer.

text: The kitchen and bathroom are here.
The living room and bedroom are there.
We are going to the living room.
There is a sofa and an armchair there.
translate: Der er en sofa og en lænestol.

text: The TV set is brand new.
Is that the train to Berlin?
When does the train arrive in Berlin?
I think this is my seat.
translate: Jeg tror, det er min plads.

text: I think you’re sitting in my seat.
translate: Jeg tror, du sidder på min plads.

text: The sleeper is at the end of the train.
translate: Sovevognen er i den bagerste del af toget.

text: And where is the dining car? – At the front.
translate: Og hvor er spisevognen? – I den forreste del.

text: Can I sleep in the middle?
Can I sleep at the top?
When will we get to the border?
How long does the journey to Berlin take?
translate: Hvor længe varer turen til Berlin?

text: Do you have something to read?
translate: Har du noget at læse i?

text: Can one get something to eat and to drink here?
translate: Kan man få noget at spise og drikke her?

text: Could you please wake me up at 7 o’clock?
translate: Vil du være så venlig at vække mig klokken 7?

text: I would like the menu, please.

translate: Jeg vil gerne have en øl.
Jeg vil gerne have en danskvand.
Jeg vil gerne have en appelsinjuice.

text: I’d like a coffee with milk.
translate: Jeg vil gerne have kaffe med mælk.

text: I’d like a tea with lemon.
translate: Jeg vil gerne have te med citron.

text: I’d like a tea with milk.
translate: Jeg vil gerne have te med mælk.

text: I’d like chips / French fries (am.) with ketchup.

translate: Og tre gange ristede pølser med sennep.

text: Do you also like to eat leek?
translate: Kan du også godt lide løg?

text: Do you also like to eat sauerkraut?
translate: Kan du også godt lide sauerkraut?

text: Do you also like to eat lentils?
translate: Kan du også godt lide linser?

text: Do you also like to eat carrots?
translate: Kan du også godt lide gulerødder?

text: Do you also like to eat broccoli?
translate: Kan du også godt lide broccoli?

text: Do you also like to eat peppers?
translate: Kan du også godt lide peberfrugt?

text: Is it dangerous to hitchhike alone?
translate: Er det farligt at tomle alene?

text: Is it dangerous to go for a walk at night?
translate: Er det farligt at gå tur om natten?

text: Is there a parking lot here?
How long can one park here?
translate: Hvor længe må man parkere her?

text: Do you take the ski lift to the top?
I’d like a glass of red wine.
translate: Jeg vil gerne have et glas rødvin.

text: I’d like a glass of white wine.
translate: Jeg vil gerne have et glas hvidvin.

text: I’d like a bottle of champagne.
translate: Jeg vil gerne have en flaske champagne.
Jeg vil gerne have noget uden kød.
Jeg vil gerne have en tallerken grøntsager.

text: I’d like something that won’t take much time.
translate: Jeg vil gerne have noget, der ikke tager så lang tid.

text: Would you like that with rice?
Would you like that with pasta?
Would you like that with potatoes?

translate: Jeg synes ikke det smager godt.
Jeg vil gerne have en forret.
Jeg vil gerne have en salat.
Jeg vil gerne have en suppe.

text: I would like an ice cream with whipped cream.
translate: Jeg vil gerne have is med flødeskum.

text: I would like some fruit or cheese.
translate: Jeg vil gerne have frugt eller ost.

text: We would like to have breakfast.
We would like to have lunch.
We would like to have dinner.
What would you like for breakfast?
translate: Hvad vil du / I have til morgenmad?
Ristet brød med pølse og ost?
Må jeg bede om en yoghurt mere?

text: Some salt and pepper also, please.
translate: Må jeg bede om salt og peber også?
Må jeg bede om et glas vand mere?

text: Do you see the tower there?
Do you see the mountain there?
Do you see the village there?
Do you see the river there?
Do you see the bridge there?
Do you see the lake there?

translate: Den der fugl kan jeg godt lide.
Det der træ kan jeg godt lide.
Den her sten kan jeg godt lide.
Den park der kan jeg godt lide.
Den have der kan jeg godt lide.
Den her blomst kan jeg godt lide.
Vær venlig og ring efter en taxa.

text: What does it cost to go to the station?
What does it cost to go to the airport?
Please turn left at the corner.

translate: Vær venlig at give mig en kvittering.

text: That is okay, please keep the change.
translate: Det stemmer, resten er til dig.
Kør mig til den her adresse.

text: Is there a good restaurant around here?
translate: Hvor er der en god restaurant?

text: Take a left at the corner.
Then go straight for a while.
translate: Så skal du gå et godt stykke ligeud.

text: Then go right for a hundred metres / meters (am.).
translate: Så skal du gå hundrede meter til højre.

text: You can also take the bus.
You can also take the tram.
You can also follow me with your car.
translate: Du kan også bare køre efter mig.

text: How do I get to the football / soccer (am.) stadium?
Drive until you reach the third traffic light.
Then turn into the first street on your right.
translate: Drej til højre ad den første gade

text: Then drive straight through the next intersection.
translate: Så skal du køre lige ud ved næste kryds.

text: Excuse me, how do I get to the airport?
translate: Undskyld, hvordan kommer jeg til lufthavnen?

text: It is best if you take the underground / subway (am.).
translate: Det er nemmest at tage metroen.

text: Simply get out at the last stop.
translate: Du skal bare køre til endestationen.

text: When is the next train to Berlin?
translate: Hvornår går det næste tog til Berlin?

text: When is the next train to Paris?
translate: Hvornår går det næste tog til Paris?

text: When is the next train to London?
translate: Hvornår går det næste tog til London?

text: When does the train for Warsaw leave?
When does the train for Stockholm leave?
When does the train for Budapest leave?
I’d like a ticket to Madrid.
translate: Jeg vil gerne have en billet til Madrid.

text: I’d like a ticket to Prague.
translate: Jeg vil gerne have en billet til Prag.

text: I’d like a ticket to Bern.
translate: Jeg vil gerne have en billet til Berlin.

text: When does the train arrive in Vienna?
When does the train arrive in Moscow?
When does the train arrive in Amsterdam?
Do I have to change trains?
From which platform does the train leave?

translate: Er der en sovevogn i toget?

text: I’d like a one-way ticket to Brussels.
translate: Jeg skal kun have en enkeltbillet til Bruxelles.

text: I’d like a return ticket to Copenhagen.
translate: Jeg vil gerne have en returbillet til København.

text: What does a berth in the sleeper cost?
translate: Hvad koster en plads i sovevognen?

text: I’d like to book a flight to Athens.
translate: Jeg vil gerne bestille en tur til Athen.
En plads ved vinduet, ikkeryger, tak.

text: I would like to confirm my reservation.
translate: Jeg vil gerne bekræfte min reservation.

text: I would like to cancel my reservation.
translate: Jeg vil gerne aflyse min reservation.

text: I would like to change my reservation.
translate: Jeg vil gerne ændre min reservation.

text: When is the next flight to Rome?
translate: Hvornår går det næste fly til Rom?
Er der stadig to ledige pladser?

text: No, we have only one seat available.
translate: Nej, vi har kun en ledig plads tilbage.

text: When does a bus go to the city centre / center (am.)?
translate: Hvornår går der en bus til centrum?

text: How much luggage can I take?
translate: Hvor meget bagage må jeg tage med?

text: Is the market open on Sundays?
Is the fair open on Mondays?
Is the exhibition open on Tuesdays?
Is the zoo open on Wednesdays?
translate: Er den zoologiske have åben om onsdagen?

text: Is the museum open on Thursdays?
Is the gallery open on Fridays?
Does one have to pay an entrance fee?
How much is the entrance fee?
Is there a discount for groups?
Is there a discount for children?
Is there a discount for students?

translate: Hvad er det der for en bygning?

text: We want to go to the cinema.
A good film is playing today.
translate: Der går en god film i dag.

text: How much are the admission tickets?
I want to sit at the back.
I want to sit at the front.
I want to sit in the middle.
translate: Jeg vil gerne sidde i midten.

text: But the book on which the film was based was better.
translate: Men bogen til filmen var bedre.

text: Where is the tourist information office?
Do you have a city map for me?
translate: Har du et kort over byen til mig?

text: Can one reserve a room here?
translate: Kan man bestille et hotelværelse her?

text: I would like a guide who speaks German.
translate: Jeg vil gerne have en guide, der taler tysk.

text: I would like a guide who speaks Italian.
translate: Jeg vil gerne have en guide, der taler italiensk.

text: I would like a guide who speaks French.
translate: Jeg vil gerne have en guide, der taler fransk.

text: I also have a video camera.
Where can I find a battery?
There is a café over there.
There is a restaurant over there.
Where are the gorillas and the zebras?
Where are the tigers and the crocodiles?
Where is the next gas station?
I have a flat tyre / tire (am.).
Can you change the tyre / tire (am.)?
I need a few litres / liters (am.) of diesel.
translate: Jeg har brug for nogle liter diesel.

text: I have no more petrol / gas (am.).
Do you have a petrol can / jerry can / gas can (am.)?
Where can I make a call?

translate: Jeg har brug for en bugseringsservice.

text: Do you have a mobile / cell phone (am.) with you?
translate: Har du en mobiltelefon på dig?

text: Which bus goes to the city centre / center (am.)?
Which bus do I have to take?
Where do I have to change?
How much does a ticket cost?
How many stops are there before downtown / the city centre?
translate: Hvor mange stoppesteder er der til centrum?

text: You have to get off here.
You have to get off at the back.
The next train is in 5 minutes.
The next tram is in 10 minutes.
translate: Den næste sporvogn kommer om 10 minutter.

text: The next bus is in 15 minutes.
translate: Den næste bus kommer om 15 minutter.

text: A ticket? – No, I don’t have one.
translate: Et kørekort? – Nej, det har jeg ikke.

text: Then you have to pay a fine.
translate: Så skal du betale en bøde.

text: You have to pack our suitcase!

translate: Du har brug for en stor kuffert!

text: Don’t forget your traveller’s cheques / traveler’s checks (am.)!
Take some suntan lotion with you.
Take the sun hat with you.
Do you want to take a road map?
translate: Vil du tage et bykort med?

text: Do you want to take a travel guide?
translate: Vil du tage en guidebog med?

text: Do you want to take an umbrella?
translate: Vil du tage en paraply med?

text: Remember to take pants, shirts and socks.
Remember to take ties, belts and sports jackets.
Remember to take pyjamas, nightgowns and t-shirts.
You need shoes, sandals and boots.
translate: Du har brug for sko, sandaler og støvler.

text: You need handkerchiefs, soap and a nail clipper.
translate: Du har brug for lommetørklæder, sæbe og en neglesaks.

text: You need a comb, a toothbrush and toothpaste.
translate: Du har brug for en kam, en tandbørste og tandpasta.

text: What’s playing at the theatre / theater (am.) this evening?
translate: Hvad går der i teatret i aften?

text: What’s playing at the cinema / movies (am.) this evening?
translate: Hvad går der i biografen i aften?
Hvad er der i fjernsynet i aften?

text: Are tickets for the theatre / theater (am.) still available?
translate: Er der stadig billetter til teatret?

text: Are tickets for the cinema / movies (am.) still available?
translate: Er der stadig billetter til biografen?

text: Are tickets for the football / soccer am. game still available?
translate: Er der stadig billetter til fodboldkampen?

text: I want to sit in the back.
I want to sit somewhere in the middle.
translate: Jeg vil gerne sidde et eller andet sted i midten.

text: I want to sit at the front.
Can you get me a ticket?
translate: Kan du skaffe mit en billet?

text: Is there a golf course nearby?
translate: Er der en golfbane i nærheden?

text: Is there a tennis court nearby?
translate: Er der en tennisbane i nærheden?

text: Is there an indoor swimming pool nearby?
translate: Er der en svømmehal i nærheden?

text: Isn’t it dangerous to swim there?
translate: Er det ikke farligt at bade der?

text: Can one rent a sun umbrella / parasol here?
translate: Kan man låne en parasol her?

text: Can one rent a deck chair here?
translate: Kan man låne en liggestol her?

text: Can one rent a boat here?
translate: Kan man låne en båd her?
Jeg kunne godt tænke mig at surfe.
Jeg kunne godt tænke mig at dykke.

text: I would like to water ski.
translate: Jeg kunne godt tænke mig at stå på vandski.
Jeg ved allerede hvordan man gør.
Må jeg sætte mig ved jer?

text: How do you like the music?
But the band plays very well.
No, this is the first time.

translate: Jeg har aldrig været her før.
Jeg er ikke så god til at danse.

text: We’re looking for a sports shop.
We’re looking for a butcher shop.
We’re looking for a pharmacy / drugstore (am.).
We want to buy a football.
translate: Vi vil nemlig gerne købe en fodbold.
Vi vil nemlig gerne købe salami.
Vi vil nemlig gerne købe noget medicin.

text: We’re looking for a sports shop to buy a football.
translate: Vi leder efter en sportsforretning, så vi kan købe en fodbold.

text: We’re looking for a butcher shop to buy salami.
translate: Vi leder efter en slagter, så vi kan købe salami.

text: We’re looking for a drugstore to buy medicine.
translate: Vi leder efter et apotek, så vi kan købe medicin.

text: I’m looking for a jeweller / jeweler (am.).
I’m looking for a photo equipment store.
I actually plan to buy a ring.
translate: Jeg vil nemlig købe en ring.

text: I actually plan to buy a roll of film.
translate: Jeg vil nemlig købe en film.

text: I actually plan to buy a cake.
translate: Jeg vil nemlig købe en lagkage.

text: I’m looking for a jeweler to buy a ring.
translate: Jeg leder efter en juveler, så jeg kan købe en ring.

text: I’m looking for a photo shop to buy a roll of film.
translate: Jeg leder efter en fotoforretning, så jeg kan købe en film.

text: I’m looking for a confectionery to buy a cake.
translate: Jeg leder efter et konditori, så jeg kan købe en lagkage.

text: What do you do for a living?
I work as a nurse part-time.
We will soon receive our pension.
What would you like to become some day?
I would like to become an engineer.
I want to go to college.
I am doing an internship abroad.
translate: Jeg er i praktik i udlandet.

text: We always go to the cafeteria at noon.
translate: I frokostpausen går vi altid i kantinen.

text: I am looking for a job.
I have already been unemployed for a year.
translate: Jeg har været arbejdsløs i et år.

text: There are too many unemployed people in this country.
translate: Der er for mange arbejdsløse i det her land.

text: I want to buy a present.
translate: Jeg vil gerne købe en gave.
Men ikke noget alt for dyrt.

text: A large one or a small one?
May I see this one, please?
translate: Må jeg se på den der?

text: Or is it made of plastic?

translate: Det er en særlig god kvalitet.

text: And the bag is really very reasonable.
translate: Og håndtasken er virkelig meget billig.

text: Can I exchange it if needed?

translate: Vi pakker den ind som gave.

text: Shall we go to the swimming pool?

translate: Har du lyst til at tage ud at svømme?

text: Do you have a bathing suit?
Can you jump in the water?
I am getting out of the water now.
translate: Jeg går op af vandet nu.

text: I want to go to the library.
I want to go to the bookstore.
I want to go to the newspaper stand.
I want to borrow a book.
I want to buy a book.
I want to buy a newspaper.
I want to go to the library to borrow a book.
translate: Jeg vil på biblioteket for at låne en bog.

text: I want to go to the bookstore to buy a book.
translate: Jeg vil i boghandlen for at købe en bog.

text: I want to go to the kiosk / newspaper stand to buy a newspaper.
translate: Jeg vil i kiosken for at købe en avis.

text: I want to go to the optician.
I want to go to the supermarket.
I want to go to the bakery.
I want to buy some glasses.
translate: Jeg vil købe et par briller.

text: Shall we go to the department store?
translate: Skal vi tage ind i et stormagasin?

text: I want to do a lot of shopping.
I want to buy fruit and vegetables.
translate: Jeg vil købe frugt og grøntsager.

text: I want to buy rolls and bread.
translate: Jeg vil købe rundstykker og brød.

text: I want to go to the optician to buy glasses.
translate: Jeg vil til optikeren for at købe et par briller.

text: I want to go to the supermarket to buy fruit and vegetables.
translate: Jeg vil i supermarkedet for at købe frugt og grøntsager.

text: I want to go to the baker to buy rolls and bread.
translate: Jeg vil til bageren for at købe rundstykker og brød.
Jeg har brug for konvolutter og brevpapir.
Jeg har brug for kuglepenne og tusser.

text: I need a cupboard and a chest of drawers.
translate: Jeg har brug for et skab og en kommode.

text: I need a desk and a bookshelf.
translate: Jeg har brug for et skrivebord og en reol.

text: I need a doll and a teddy bear.
translate: Jeg har brug for en dukke og en bamse.

text: I need a football and a chess board.
translate: Jeg har brug for en fodbold og et skakspil.

text: I need a hammer and a pair of pliers.
translate: Jeg har brug for en hammer og en tang.

text: I need a drill and a screwdriver.
translate: Jeg har brug for et bor og en skruetrækker.

text: Where is the jewellery / jewelry (am.) department?
I need a chain and a bracelet.
translate: Jeg skal bruge en halskæde og et armbånd.

text: I need a ring and earrings.
translate: Jeg skal bruge en ring og nogle øreringe.

text: The man is wearing a hat.
One cannot see the ears either.
translate: Ørene kan man heller ikke se.

text: One cannot see his back either.
translate: Ryggen kan man heller ikke se.

text: I am drawing the eyes and the mouth.
The man is dancing and laughing.
The man has a long nose.
He is carrying a cane in his hands.
translate: Han har en stok i hænderne.

text: He is also wearing a scarf around his neck.
translate: Han har også et halstørklæde om halsen.

text: It is winter and it is cold.
translate: Det er vinter og det er koldt.

text: The man is made of snow.
He is neither wearing pants nor a coat.
translate: Han har ingen bukser på og ingen frakke på.

text: But the man is not freezing.
Where is the nearest post office?
Is the post office far from here?
translate: Hvor langt er der til det nærmeste posthus?

text: Where is the nearest mail box?
I need a couple of stamps.
translate: Jeg har brug for et par frimærker.

text: For a card and a letter.
translate: Til et postkort og et brev.

text: How much is the postage to America?
Can I send it by air mail?
translate: Kan jeg sende den med luftpost?

text: How long will it take to get there?
translate: Hvor længe varer det inden den ankommer?

text: Where can I make a call?
Where is the nearest telephone booth?
Do you have a telephone directory?
Do you know the area code for Austria?
One moment, I’ll look it up.
translate: Et øjeblik, jeg ser lige efter.

text: You have to dial a zero first!
Do the students learn a lot?
Do you often ask the teacher questions?
No, I don’t ask him questions often.
translate: Nej, jeg spørger ham ikke tit.

text: Yes, he is working right now.
I would like to open an account.
translate: Jeg vil gerne åbne en konto.

text: I want to deposit money in my account.
translate: Jeg vil gerne indbetale penge på min konto.

text: I want to withdraw money from my account.
translate: Jeg vil gerne hæve penge fra min konto.

text: I want to pick up the bank statements.
I want to cash a traveller’s cheque / traveler’s check (am.).
translate: Jeg vil gerne indløse en rejsecheck.

text: I’m expecting a transfer from Germany.
translate: Jeg forventer en overførsel fra Tyskland.
Jeg vil gerne veksle de her penge.

text: Could you please give me small notes / bills (am.)?
Is there a cashpoint / an ATM (am.)?
How much money can one withdraw?
translate: Hvor mange penge kan man hæve?

text: Which credit cards can one use?
Where is the football / soccer (am.) field?
My foot and hand also hurt.
translate: Min fod og min hånd gør også ondt.

text: I have a car / an automobile.
I also have a jacket and a pair of jeans.
translate: Jeg har også en jakke og et par cowboybukser.

text: I have a knife, a fork and a spoon.
translate: Jeg har en kniv, en gaffel og en ske.

text: Where is the salt and pepper?

translate: Jeg har en tid hos lægen.

text: I have the appointment at ten o’clock.
Please take a seat in the waiting room.
The doctor is on his way.
What insurance company do you belong to?
What can I do for you?
translate: Hvad kan jeg gøre for dig?
Jeg har altid smerter i ryggen.

text: Lie down on the examining table.
translate: Vær sød at lægge dig på briksen!

text: I will give you an injection.
I will give you some pills.
I am giving you a prescription for the pharmacy.
translate: Jeg giver dig en recept til apoteket.

text: I am a member of a sports club.
translate: Jeg er med i en idrætsforening.

text: There is a football / soccer (am.) stadium in our city.
translate: I vores by er der et fodboldstadion.

text: There is also a swimming pool with a sauna.
translate: Der er også en svømmehal med sauna.

text: And there is a golf course.
There is a football / soccer (am.) match on now.
translate: Der er en fodboldkamp lige nu.

text: The German team is playing against the English one.
translate: Det tyske landshold spiller mod det engelske.

text: Six months make half a year.
translate: Seks måneder er et halvt år.

text: We feel like. / We want to.
We don’t feel like. / We do’t want to.

translate: Jeg har brug for en seng.
Jeg har brug for en lampe.
Jeg har brug for en telefon.

text: I want to make a call.

translate: Jeg har brug for et kamera.
Jeg har brug for en computer.

text: I want to send an email.

translate: Jeg har brug for en kuglepen.

text: Is there a sheet of paper and a pen here?
translate: Er der et stykke papir og en kuglepen her?

text: Where has he left his glasses?
translate: Hvor har han dog sine briller?

text: The clock hangs on the wall.

translate: Hvor har han dog sit pas?

text: The children cannot find their parents.
translate: Børnene kan ikke finde deres forældre.
Men der kommer deres forældre jo!

text: How was your trip, Mr. Miller?
translate: Hvordan var Deres rejse, hr. Müller?

text: Where is your wife, Mr. Miller?
translate: Hvor er Deres kone, hr. Müller?

text: How was your trip, Mrs. Smith?
translate: Hvordan var Deres rejse, fru Schmidt?

text: Where is your husband, Mrs. Smith?
translate: Hvor er Deres mand, fru Schmidt?

text: What do you want to do?
Do you want to play football / soccer (am.)?
Do you want to visit friends?
I don’t want to arrive late.
translate: Jeg vil ikke komme for sent.

text: I don’t want to go there.
I want to stay at home.
Do you want to stay here?
Do you want to eat here?
Do you want to sleep here?
Do you want to leave tomorrow?
translate: Vil du tage af sted i morgen?

text: Do you want to stay till tomorrow?
translate: Vil du blive til i morgen?

text: Do you want to pay the bill only tomorrow?
translate: Vil du først betale regningen i morgen?

text: Would you like to go for a walk?
translate: Vil du gerne gå en tur?

text: Do you want to go to the disco?
Do you want to go to the cinema?
Do you want to go to a café?

translate: Vil du gerne have en cigaret?
Jeg vil gerne have noget at spise.

text: I want to relax a little.
translate: Jeg vil gerne slappe lidt af.

text: I want to ask you something.
translate: Jeg vil gerne spørge dig om noget.

text: I want to ask you for something.
translate: Jeg vil gerne bede dig om noget.

text: I want to treat you to something.
translate: Jeg vil gerne invitere dig til noget.

text: Or do you prefer a tea?
translate: Eller vil du hellere have te?
Vil I gerne have en taxa?

text: They want to make a call.
translate: De vil gerne ringe til nogen.
Ja, jeg kan godt forstå ham.
Ja, jeg kan godt forstå hende.

text: No, I don’t understand them so well.
translate: Nej, jeg kan ikke så godt forstå dem.
Vores morfar / farfar er meget gammel.

text: 70 years ago he was still young.
translate: For 70 år siden var han stadig ung.

text: A woman who weighs a hundred kilos is fat.
translate: En kvinde på 100 kilo er tyk.

text: A man who weighs fifty kilos is thin.
translate: En mand på 50 kilo er tynd.

text: No, it costs only one hundred Euros.
translate: Nej, den koster kun hundrede euro.

text: Do you want some more soup?

translate: Nej, jeg vil ikke have mere.

text: But I already know a lot of people.
translate: Men jeg kender allerede mange mennesker.

text: But I will be back on Sunday.
translate: Men jeg kommer tilbage allerede på søndag.

text: But she already has a boyfriend.
translate: Men hun har allerede en kæreste.
Jeg kan ikke finde min nøgle.
Jeg kan ikke finde min billet.

text: Do you know where his key is?
translate: Ved du, hvor hans nøgle er?

text: Do you know where his ticket is?
translate: Ved du, hvor hans billet er?

text: And her credit card is also gone.
translate: Og hendes kreditkort er også væk.

text: Why aren’t you eating the cake?
I’m not eating it because I must lose weight.
translate: Jeg spiser den ikke, fordi jeg skal tabe mig.

text: Why aren’t you drinking the beer?
I’m not drinking it because I have to drive.
translate: Jeg drikker den ikke, fordi jeg skal køre.

text: Why aren’t you drinking the coffee?
I’m not drinking it because it is cold.
translate: Jeg drikker den ikke, fordi den er kold.

text: Why aren’t you drinking the tea?
I’m not drinking it because I don’t have any sugar.
translate: Jeg drikker ikke teen, fordi jeg ikke har noget sukker.

text: Why aren’t you eating the soup?
I’m not eating it because I didn’t order it.
translate: Jeg spiser den ikke, fordi jeg ikke har bestilt den.

text: Why don’t you eat the meat?
I’m not eating it because I am a vegetarian.
translate: Jeg spiser det ikke, fordi jeg er vegetar.

text: I didn’t come because I was ill.
translate: Jeg kom ikke, fordi jeg var syg.

text: She didn’t come because she was tired.
translate: Hun kom ikke, fordi hun var træt.

text: He didn’t come because he wasn’t interested.
translate: Han kom ikke, fordi han ikke havde lyst.

text: We didn’t come because our car is damaged.
translate: Vi kom ikke, fordi vores bil var i stykker.

text: I am wearing a blue dress.
translate: Jeg har en blå kjole på.

text: I am wearing a red dress.
translate: Jeg har en rød kjole på.

text: I am wearing a green dress.
translate: Jeg har en grøn kjole på.

text: They didn’t come because they missed the train.
translate: De kom ikke, fordi de ikke nåede toget.

text: I didn’t come because I was not allowed to.
translate: Jeg kom ikke, fordi jeg ikke måtte.
Jeg har brug for en ny bil.
Jeg har brug for en hurtig bil.
Jeg har brug for en komfortabel bil.

text: An old lady lives at the top.
translate: Deroppe bor der en gammel kvinde.

text: A fat lady lives at the top.
translate: Deroppe bor der en tyk kvinde.
Dernede bor der en nysgerrig kvinde.

text: But the neighbours have naughty children.
I am not coming because the weather is so bad.
translate: Jeg kommer ikke, fordi vejret er så dårligt.

text: He isn’t coming because he isn’t invited.
translate: Han kommer ikke, fordi han ikke er inviteret.

text: I am not coming because I have no time.
translate: Jeg kommer ikke, fordi jeg ikke har tid.

text: I am not staying because I still have to work.
translate: Jeg bliver ikke, fordi jeg skal arbejde.
Jeg går, fordi jeg er træt.

chapter: to have to do something / must
to have to do something / must
translate: Jeg er nødt til at sende brevet.

chapter: to have to do something / must
translate: Jeg er nødt til at betale hotellet.

text: I’m going because it is already late.
translate: Jeg kører, fordi det allerede er sent.

chapter: to have to do something / must
translate: Du er nødt til at stå tidligt op.

chapter: to have to do something / must
translate: Du er nødt til at arbejde meget.

chapter: to have to do something / must
translate: Du er nødt til at være punktlig.

chapter: to have to do something / must
text: He must fuel / get petrol / get gas (am.).
translate: Han er nødt til at tanke op.

chapter: to have to do something / must
translate: Han er nødt til at reparere bilen.

chapter: to have to do something / must
translate: Han er nødt til at vaske bilen.

chapter: to have to do something / must
translate: Hun er nødt til at købe ind.

chapter: to have to do something / must
translate: Hun er nødt til at gøre rent i lejligheden.

chapter: to have to do something / must
translate: Hun er nødt til at vaske tøj.

chapter: to have to do something / must
text: We must go to school at once.
translate: Vi er nødt til at gå i skole snart.

chapter: to have to do something / must
text: We must go to work at once.
translate: Vi er nødt til at gå på arbejde snart.

chapter: to have to do something / must
text: We must go to the doctor at once.
translate: Vi er nødt til at gå til lægen snart.

chapter: to have to do something / must
text: You must wait for the bus.
translate: I er nødt til at vente på bussen.

chapter: to have to do something / must
text: You must wait for the train.
translate: I er nødt til at vente på toget

chapter: to have to do something / must
text: You must wait for the taxi.
translate: I er nødt til at vente på taxaen.

text: He is staying in a hotel.
He is staying in a cheap hotel.
translate: Han bor på et billigt hotel.

text: He is reading a boring novel.
She is watching an exciting movie.
Are you already allowed to drive?
Are you already allowed to drink alcohol?
Are you already allowed to travel abroad alone?
translate: Må du allerede tage alene til udlandet?

text: May one pay by credit card?
May one pay by cheque / check (am.)?
May one only pay in cash?
May I just make a call?
translate: Må jeg lige ringe til nogen?
Må jeg lige spørge om noget?

text: He is not allowed to sleep in the park.
translate: Han må ikke sove i parken.

text: He is not allowed to sleep in the car.
translate: Han må ikke sove i bilen.

text: He is not allowed to sleep at the train station.
translate: Han må ikke sove på stationen.
Må vi betale hver for sig?

text: She took a piece of chocolate.
He was disloyal, but she was loyal.
translate: Han var utro, men hun var tro.

text: He was lazy, but she was hard-working.
translate: Han var doven, men hun var flittig.

text: He was poor, but she was rich.
translate: Han var fattig, men hun var rig.

text: He had no money, only debts.
translate: Han havde ingen penge, men en gæld.

text: He had no luck, only bad luck.
translate: Han var ikke heldig, men uheldig.

text: He had no success, only failure.
translate: Han havde ikke succes, men uheld.

text: He was not satisfied, but dissatisfied.
translate: Han var ikke tilfreds, men utilfreds.

text: He was not happy, but sad.
translate: Han var ikke lykkelig, men ulykkelig.

text: He was not friendly, but unfriendly.
translate: Han var ikke sympatisk, men usympatisk.

text: The pictures are on the CD.
The pictures are in the camera.
Can you clean the pants / trousers?
Do you have a match or a lighter?
translate: Har du tændstikker eller en lighter?
Hvilket slips har du haft på?

text: Which newspaper did you subscribe to?
translate: Hvilken avis har du haft abonnement på?

text: Why did you become a teacher?
Why did you take a taxi?
translate: Hvorfor har du taget en taxa?

text: How did you pass the exam?
How did you find the way?
With whom did you make an appointment?
translate: Hvem har du en aftale med?

text: With whom did you celebrate your birthday?
translate: Hvem har du fejret fødselsdag med?

text: What did you come to know?
translate: Hvad har du fundet ud af?

text: We had to water the flowers.
translate: Vi var nødt til at vande blomsterne.

text: We had to clean the apartment.
translate: Vi var nødt til at rydde op i lejligheden.

text: We had to wash the dishes.
translate: Vi var nødt til at vaske op.

text: Did you have to pay the bill?
translate: Var I nødt til at I betale regningen?

text: Did you have to pay an entrance fee?
translate: Var I nødt til at betale entré?

text: Did you have to pay a fine?

translate: Hvem var nødt til at sige farvel?

text: Who had to go home early?
Who had to take the train?
translate: Hvem var nødt til at tage toget?

text: We did not want to stay long.
We did not want to drink anything.
We did not want to disturb you.
I just wanted to make a call.
translate: Jeg ville lige ringe til nogen.

text: I just wanted to call a taxi.
Actually I wanted to drive home.
I thought you wanted to call your wife.
translate: Jeg troede, du ville ringe til din kone.

text: I thought you wanted to call information.
translate: Jeg troede, du ville ringe til oplysningen?

text: I thought you wanted to order a pizza.
translate: Jeg troede, du ville bestille en pizza.
Det irriterer mig, at du snorker.

text: I’m angry that you drink so much beer.
translate: Det irriterer mig, at du drikker så meget øl.

text: I’m angry that you come so late.
translate: Det irriterer mig, at du kommer så sent.

text: I think he needs a doctor.
translate: Jeg tror, at han har brug for en læge.
Jeg tror, at han er syg.

text: I think he is sleeping now.
translate: Jeg tror, at han sover nu.

text: We hope that he marries our daughter.
translate: Vi håber, at han gifter sig med vores datter.

text: We hope that he has a lot of money.
translate: Vi håber, at han har mange penge.

text: We hope that he is a millionaire.
translate: Vi håber, at han er millionær.

text: I heard that your wife had an accident.
translate: Jeg har hørt, at din kone var med i en ulykke.

text: I heard that she is in the hospital.
translate: Jeg har hørt, at hun ligger på sygehuset.

text: I heard that your car is completely wrecked.
translate: Jeg har hørt, at din bil er totalskadet.
Det glæder mig, at du er kommet.

text: I’m happy that you are interested.
translate: Det glæder mig, at du er interesseret.

text: I’m happy that you want to buy the house.
translate: Det glæder mig, at du vil købe huset.

text: I’m afraid the last bus has already gone.
translate: Jeg er bange for, at den sidste bus allerede er kørt.

text: I’m afraid we will have to take a taxi.
translate: Jeg er bange for, at vi er nødt til at tage en taxa.

text: I’m afraid I have no more money.
translate: Jeg er bange for, at jeg ikke har nogen penge har med.

text: I’ll wait until my hair is dry.
translate: Jeg venter, til mit hår er tørt.

text: I’ll wait until the film is over.
translate: Jeg venter, til filmen er forbi.

text: I’ll wait until the traffic light is green.
translate: Jeg venter, til lyset skifter til grønt.

text: When do you go on holiday?
Yes, before the summer holidays begin.
Repair the roof before the winter begins.
Wash your hands before you sit at the table.
translate: Vask dine hænder, før du sætter dig til bords.

text: Close the window before you go out.
translate: Luk vinduet, før du går ud.

text: Yes, after the class is over.
After he had an accident, he could not work anymore.
translate: Efter han var med i en ulykke, kunne han ikke arbejde mere.

text: After he had lost his job, he went to America.
translate: Efter at han havde mistet sit arbejde, tog han til Amerika.

text: After he went to America, he became rich.
translate: Efter at han var rejst til Amerika, blev han rig.
Jeg har svaret på alle spørgsmål.

text: I know that – I knew that.
translate: Jeg ved det – jeg har vidst det.

text: I write that – I wrote that.
translate: Jeg skriver det – jeg har skrevet det.

text: I hear that – I heard that.
translate: Jeg hører det – jeg har hørt det.

text: I’ll get it – I got it.
translate: Jeg henter det – jeg har hentet det.

text: I’ll bring that – I brought that.
translate: Jeg tager det med – jeg har taget det med.

text: I was talking on the phone all the time.
translate: Jeg har talt i telefon hele tiden.

text: I’ll buy that – I bought that.
translate: Jeg køber det – jeg har købt det.

text: I expect that – I expected that.
translate: Jeg forventer det – jeg har forventet det.

text: I’ll explain that – I explained that.
translate: Jeg forklarer det – jeg har forklaret det.

text: I know that – I knew that.
translate: Jeg kender det – jeg har kendt det.
Jeg har studeret / læst lektier hele aftenen.

text: Perhaps the weather will get better tomorrow.
translate: Vejret bliver måske bedre i morgen.

text: I hope that it gets better.
translate: Jeg håber, at det bliver bedre.

text: My son did not want to play with the doll.
translate: Min søn ville ikke lege med dukken.

text: My daughter did not want to play football / soccer (am.).
translate: Min datter ville ikke spille fodbold.

text: My wife did not want to play chess with me.
translate: Min kone ville ikke spille skak med mig.

text: My children did not want to go for a walk.
translate: Mine børn ville ikke gå en tur.

text: They did not want to tidy the room.
translate: De ville ikke rydde op på værelset.

text: Do you know that for sure?
I think that it is old.
translate: Jeg formoder, at den er gammel.
Jeg synes endda, at han ser rigtig godt ud.

text: The boss definitely has a girlfriend.
It is very possible that he has a girlfriend.
translate: Det er meget muligt, at han har en kæreste.

text: They did not want to go to bed.
translate: De ville ikke gå i seng.

text: He was not allowed to eat ice cream.
translate: Han måtte ikke spise en is.

text: He was not allowed to eat chocolate.
He was not allowed to eat sweets.
I was allowed to make a wish.
I was allowed to buy myself a dress.
I was allowed to take a chocolate.
translate: Jeg måtte tage et stykke fyldt chokolade.

text: Were you allowed to smoke in the airplane?
Were you allowed to drink beer in the hospital?
translate: Måtte du drikke øl på sygehuset?

text: Were you allowed to take the dog into the hotel?
translate: Måtte du tage hunden med på hotellet?

text: During the holidays the children were allowed to remain outside late.
translate: I ferien måtte børnene blive længe ude.

text: They were allowed to play in the yard for a long time.
translate: De måtte lege længe i gården.

text: They were allowed to stay up late.
You are so lazy – don’t be so lazy!
translate: Du er så doven! – Vær dog ikke så doven!

text: You sleep for so long – don’t sleep so late!
translate: Du sover så længe! – Sov dog ikke så længe!

text: You come home so late – don’t come home so late!
translate: Du kommer så for sent – kom dog ikke så sent!

text: You laugh so loudly – don’t laugh so loudly!
translate: Du griner så højt! – Grin dog ikke så højt

text: You speak so softly – don’t speak so softly!
translate: Du taler så lavt – tal dog ikke så lavt!

text: You drink too much – don’t drink so much!
translate: Du drikker for meget – drik dog ikke så meget!

text: You smoke too much – don’t smoke so much!
translate: Du ryger for meget – ryg dog ikke så meget!

text: You work too much – don’t work so much!
translate: Du arbejder for meget – arbejd dog ikke så meget!

text: You drive too fast – don’t drive so fast!
translate: Du kører så hurtigt – kør dog ikke så hurtigt!

text: I don’t know if he loves me.
translate: Jeg ved ikke, om han elsker mig.

text: I don’t know if he’ll come back.
translate: Jeg ved ikke, om han kommer tilbage.

text: I don’t know if he’ll call me.
translate: Jeg ved ikke, om han ringer til mig.

text: I wonder if he thinks about me.
translate: Jeg spørger mig selv, om han tænker på mig.

text: I wonder if he has someone else.
translate: Jeg spørger mig selv, om han har en anden.
Jeg spørger mig selv, om han lyver.

text: Maybe he tells me the truth?
I doubt whether he really likes me.
translate: Jeg tvivler på, at han virkelig kan lide mig.

text: I doubt whether he’ll write to me.
translate: Jeg tvivler på, at han skriver til mig.

text: I doubt whether he’ll marry me.
translate: Jeg tvivler på, at han gifter sig med mig.
Mon han virkelig kan lide mig?
Mon han gifter sig med mig?

text: Did you have to call an ambulance?
translate: Måtte du ringe efter en ambulance?

text: Did you have to call the doctor?
Did you have to call the police?
Do you have the telephone number? I had it just now.
translate: Har du telefonnummeret? Jeg har lige haft det.

text: Do you have the address? I had it just now.
translate: Har du adressen? Jeg har lige haft den.

text: Do you have the city map? I had it just now.
translate: Har du kortet over byen? Jeg har lige haft det.

text: Did he come on time? He could not come on time.
translate: Kom han til tiden? Han kunne ikke komme til tiden.

text: Did he find the way? He could not find the way.
translate: Fandt han vej? Han kunne ikke finde vej.

text: Did he understand you? He could not understand me.
translate: Forstod han dig? Han kunne ikke forstå mig.

text: Why could you not come on time?
translate: Hvorfor kunne du ikke komme til tiden?

text: Why could you not find the way?
translate: Hvorfor kunne du ikke finde vej?

text: Why could you not understand him?
translate: Hvorfor kunne du ikke forstå ham?

text: I could not come on time because there were no buses.
translate: Jeg kunne ikke komme til tiden, fordi der ikke kørte nogen bus.

text: I could not find the way because I had no city map.
translate: Jeg kunne ikke finde vejen, fordi jeg ikke havde et kort over byen.

text: I could not understand him because the music was so loud.
translate: Jeg kunne ikke forstå ham, fordi musikken var så høj.

text: I had to take a taxi.
translate: Jeg var nødt til at tage en taxa.

text: I had to buy a city map.
translate: Jeg var nødt til at købe et kort over byen.

text: I had to switch off the radio.
translate: Jeg var nødt til at slukke for radioen.

text: The button from the shirt is gone.
translate: Knappen på skjorten er faldet af.

text: The boss’ computer is not working.
How do I get to her parents’ house?
translate: Hvordan kommer jeg til hendes forældres hus?

text: The house is at the end of the road.
translate: Huset ligger for enden af gaden.

text: What is the name of the capital city of Switzerland?
What is the title of the book?
What are the names of the neighbour’s / neighbor’s (am.) children?
What are the doctor’s consultation times?
What time is the museum open?
Have you already been to Berlin?
translate: Har du nogensinde været i Berlin?

text: No, I don’t know anyone here.
a little longer – not much longer
Will you stay here a little longer?
No, I won’t stay here much longer.
translate: Nej, jeg bliver her ikke meget længere.

text: Would you like to drink something else?
translate: Vil du have noget mere at drikke?

text: No, I don’t want anything else.
translate: Nej tak, jeg vil ikke have mere.

text: No, I haven’t eaten anything yet.
translate: Nej, jeg har ikke spist noget endnu.

text: Does anyone else want a coffee?
translate: Er der flere, der vil have kaffe?

text: Since when is she no longer working?
translate: Hvornår holdt hun op med at arbejde?

text: Yes, she is no longer working since she got married.
translate: Ja, hun holdt op med at arbejde, da hun blev gift.

text: Since she got married, she’s no longer working.
translate: Efter hun blev gift, har hun ikke arbejdet.

text: Since they have met each other, they are happy.
translate: Fra de mødte hinanden, har de været lykkelige.

text: Since they have had children, they rarely go out.
translate: Efter de har fået børn, går de sjældent ud.
Hun taler i telefon, mens hun kører bil.

text: She watches TV while she irons.
translate: Hun ser fjernsyn, mens hun stryger.

text: She listens to music while she does her work.
translate: Hun lytter til musik, mens hun laver sine lektier.

text: I can’t see anything when I don’t have glasses.
translate: Jeg kan ikke se noget, når jeg ikke har briller på.

text: I can’t understand anything when the music is so loud.
translate: Jeg forstår ingenting, når musikken er så høj.

text: I can’t smell anything when I have a cold.
translate: Jeg kan ikke lugte noget, når jeg er forkølet.

text: We’ll take a taxi if it rains.
translate: Vi tager en taxa, hvis det regner.

text: We’ll travel around the world if we win the lottery.
translate: Vi rejser verden rundt, hvis vi vinder i lotto.

text: We’ll start eating if he doesn’t come soon.
translate: Vi begynder at spise, hvis han ikke snart kommer.

text: He fell asleep although the TV was on.
translate: Han er faldet i søvn, selvom fjernsynet var tændt.

text: He stayed a while although it was late.
translate: Han blev der, selvom klokken allerede var mange.

text: He didn’t come although we had made an appointment.
translate: Han kom ikke, selvom vi havde en aftale.

text: The TV was on. Nevertheless, he fell asleep.
translate: Fjernsynet var tændt. Alligevel faldt han i søvn.

text: It was already late. Nevertheless, he stayed a while.
translate: Det var allerede sent. Alligevel blev han.

text: We had made an appointment. Nevertheless, he didn’t come.
translate: Vi havde en aftale. Alligevel kom han ikke.

text: Although he has no license, he drives the car.
translate: Selvom han ikke har kørekort, kører han bil.

text: Although the road is slippery, he drives so fast.
translate: Selvom vejen er glat, kører han hurtigt.

text: Although he is drunk, he rides his bicycle.
translate: Selvom han er fuld, kører han på cykel.

text: Despite having no licence / license (am.), he drives the car.
translate: Han har ikke noget kørekort. Alligevel kører han bil.

text: Despite the road being slippery, he drives fast.
translate: Vejen er glat. Alligevel kører han så hurtigt.

text: Despite being drunk, he rides the bike.
translate: Han er beruset. Alligevel kører han på cykel.

text: Although she went to college, she can’t find a job.
translate: Hun kan ikke finde et job, selvom hun har studeret.

text: Although she is in pain, she doesn’t go to the doctor.
translate: Hun går ikke til lægen, selvom hun har smerter.

text: Although she has no money, she buys a car.
translate: Hun køber en bil, selvom hun ikke har nogen penge.

text: She went to college. Nevertheless, she can’t find a job.
translate: Hun har studeret. Alligevel kan hun ikke finde et job.

text: She is in pain. Nevertheless, she doesn’t go to the doctor.
translate: Hun har smerter. Alligevel går hun ikke til lægen.

text: She has no money. Nevertheless, she buys a car.
translate: Hun har ingen penge. Alligevel køber hun en bil.

text: I get up as soon as the alarm rings.
translate: Jeg står op, så snart vækkeuret ringer.

text: I become tired as soon as I have to study.
translate: Jeg bliver træt lige så snart jeg skal studere / læse lektier.

text: I will stop working as soon as I am 60.
translate: Jeg holder op med at arbejde, så snart jeg fylder 60.

text: As soon as I have a moment.
translate: Så snart jeg har tid et øjeblik.

text: He’ll call, as soon as he has a little time.
translate: Han ringer, så snart han har lidt tid.

text: I’ll work as long as I can.
translate: Jeg vil arbejde, så længe jeg kan.

text: I’ll work as long as I am healthy.
translate: Jeg vil arbejde, så længe jeg er rask.

text: He lies in bed instead of working.
translate: Han ligger i sengen i stedet for at arbejde.

text: She reads the newspaper instead of cooking.
translate: Hun læser avis i stedet for at lave mad.

text: He is at the bar instead of going home.
translate: Han sidder på værtshus i stedet for at gå hjem.

text: As far as I know, he lives here.
translate: Så vidt jeg ved, bor han her.

text: As far as I know, his wife is ill.
translate: Så vidt jeg ved, er hans kone syg.

text: As far as I know, he is unemployed.
translate: Så vidt jeg ved, er han arbejdsløs.

text: I overslept; otherwise I’d have been on time.
translate: Jeg sov over mig, ellers ville jeg have været kommet til tiden.

text: I missed the bus; otherwise I’d have been on time.
translate: Jeg kom for sent til bussen, ellers ville jeg være kommet til tiden.

text: I didn’t find the way / I got lost; otherwise I’d have been on time.
translate: Jeg kunne ikke finde vej, ellers ville jeg være kommet til tiden.

text: The journey was beautiful, but too tiring.
translate: Rejsen var ganske vist dejlig, men for anstrengende.

text: The train was on time, but too full.
translate: Toget kom ganske vist til tiden, men det var for fyldt.

text: The hotel was comfortable, but too expensive.
translate: Hotellet var ganske vist hyggeligt men for dyrt.

text: He’ll take either the bus or the train.
translate: Han tager enten bussen eller toget.

text: He’ll come either this evening or tomorrow morning.
translate: Han kommer enten i aften eller i morgen tidlig.

text: He’s going to stay either with us or in the hotel.
translate: Han bor enten hos os eller på hotel.

text: She speaks Spanish as well as English.
translate: Hun taler både spansk og engelsk.

text: She has lived in Madrid as well as in London.
translate: Hun har boet både i Madrid og i London.

text: She knows Spain as well as England.
translate: Hun kender både Spanien og England.

text: He is not only stupid, but also lazy.
translate: Han er ikke bare dum men også doven.

text: She is not only pretty, but also intelligent.
translate: Hun er ikke bare smuk men også intelligent.

text: She speaks not only German, but also French.
translate: Hun taler ikke bare tysk men også fransk.

text: I can neither play the piano nor the guitar.
translate: Jeg kan hverken spille klaver eller guitar.

text: I can neither waltz nor do the samba.
translate: Jeg kan hverken danse vals eller samba.

text: I like neither opera nor ballet.
translate: Jeg kan hverken lide opera eller ballet.

text: The faster you work, the earlier you will be finished.
translate: Jo hurtigere du arbejder, jo tidligere er du færdig.

text: The earlier you come, the earlier you can go.
translate: Jo tidligere du kommer, jo tidligere kan du gå.

text: The older one gets, the more complacent one gets.
translate: Jo ældre man bliver, jo mere bekvem bliver man.
